description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s decision to stake the Conservative Party’s future on a rare summer election was so secret that even his chancellor of the exchequer, Jeremy Hunt, appeared surprised by the plan.
title: Sunak Blindsided His Own Chancellor With Early UK Election Call

description: Good morning, it's Georgie here in Sydney. Here’s what we’re looking at today...Today’s must-reads:• BHP has a week to convince Anglo• Aware Super to boost London office• RBNZ signals tighter for longer
title: BHP Wins More Time

description: The US Justice Department and a group of states will sue Live Nation Entertainment Inc. for antitrust violations related to Ticketmaster’s unrivaled control of concert ticket sales, according to people familiar with the case.
title: US Justice Department to Seek Breakup of Live Nation-Ticketmaster

description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro ordered his government to open an embassy in the Palestinian administrative capital of Ramallah, the country’s foreign affairs minister said.
title: Colombia Plans to Open an Embassy to Palestine in Ramallah

description: The list of foreign dignitaries attending President Ebrahim Raisi’s funeral on Wednesday offered a testimony to just how much Iran’s efforts to blunt US sanctions in the years since Donald Trump left office has paid off.
title: Leaders at Raisi Funeral Highlight Iran’s Work to Repair Arab Ties

description: Keir Starmer had been waiting for the announcement for well over a year. The leader of the UK’s opposition Labour Party looked on happily as Prime Minister Rishi Sunak launched what almost everyone expects will be a failed campaign to stay in power after an election on July 4.
title: Labour Finally Has UK Election It Craves, But Traps Lie in Wait

description: President Joe Biden’s administration emphasized its “unwavering support” for the independence of central banks, following heightened speculation over how Donald Trump could ramp up pressure on the Federal Reserve if he wins another term in the White House.
title: White House Touts Support for Fed Independence as Trump Advisers Eye Changes

description: Harvard University’s governing board said it’s declining to award degrees to 13 students who violated the university’s policies by participating in a pro-Palestinian encampment on campus.
title: Harvard Defies Faculty Vote to Block 13 Students From Graduating

description: Nikki Haley, who challenged Donald Trump for the Republican nomination, said she plans to vote for her former rival in November, becoming the latest critic of the former president to back his White House bid.
title: Nikki Haley Says She Will Vote for Donald Trump in November

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Seattle bureau chief Anna Edgerton looks at voter concerns about AI and privacy. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Privacy Worries Make Voters Wary of Growing AI Presence

description: Hunter Biden’s criminal trial on tax violations will be postponed until Sept. 5, the federal judge overseeing the case ruled.
title: Hunter Biden Criminal Tax Trial Postponed to Sept. 5 in Los Angeles

description: On this special edition of Voternomics, we discuss the possible reasoning behind the Conservative’s decision to gamble on an earlier-than-expected vote.
title: Why Did Rishi Sunak Call For a July 4 UK Election?

description: Nigel Farage has said he will think "overnight" about whether he will be standing for the Reform UK in the upcoming General Election.
title: Nigel Farage to Think 'Overnight' About Reform Candidacy in General Election

description: French President Emmanuel Macron’s government is targeting savings of €3.6 billion ($3.9 billion) from his planned reforms to unemployment insurance, Agence France-Presse reported.
title: Macron Aims to Save $3.9 Billion in Welfare Reform, AFP Reports

description: As visual images go, it was bad. In the pouring rain, UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak was drowned out by Tony Blair’s election anthem “Things Can Only Get Better” as he announced a general election for July 4.
title: Rain and Blaring Music Overshadow Rishi Sunak’s Election Moment

description: The Canadian government released its first-ever cybersecurity strategy on Wednesday, with the aim of addressing challenges posed by remote work, cloud computing, aging infrastructure and recruitment.
title: Remote Work, Aging Tech Targeted by Canada Cybersecurity Plan

description: Ireland, Norway and Spain have said they will recognize Palestine as a state, breaking from a consensus within Western Europe and the US that the Palestinians should achieve statehood through negotiations with Israel. Already, the great majority of countries in the world — around 140 of them — recognize a Palestinian state. The declarations have symbolic value for the Palestinians, and they serve to diplomatically isolate Israel, whose government opposes a Palestinian state. But they don’t mean
title: Is Palestine a State? What It Means When Countries Say It Is

description: Venezuela’s opposition is weighing a move that would slow the sale of oil assets under its control by having Citgo Petroleum Corp.’s holding company file for bankruptcy in the US, according to people familiar with the deliberations.
title: Citgo’s Venezuelan Parent Weighs US Bankruptcy to Slow Sale

description: Democrats are asking the Department of Justice to investigate major oil companies and their trade groups following a congressional probe that concluded with allegations that Big Oil spent decades deceiving the public about the affects of climate change.
title: Big Oil Investigation Sent to Justice Department by Democrats

description: Ukraine’s anti-graft authority notified a former deputy head of Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s office he is suspected of illicit enrichment, as pressure grows on the president to show results in the fight against corruption.
title: Ukraine Accuses Former Zelenskiy Aide of Illicit Enrichment

description: Vulcan Materials Co. rejected an offer by the Mexican government to purchase its Caribbean coast assets for $2 billion, the nation’s president said, adding that the state hasn’t expropriated the property.
title: AMLO Says Vulcan Rejected $2 Billion Bid for Mexico Coast Assets

description: A measure of the pound’s expected swings jumped amid speculation the UK was headed for an election earlier than widely expected.
title: Pound Volatility Seen Rising Amid Speculation of UK Vote in July

description: The UK will hold a general election on July 4, the BBC reported on Wednesday.
title: UK General Election Will be Held on July 4, BBC Reports

description: Rishi Sunak
title: UK General Election Will Be Held in July, Reports Say

description: South Africa’s ruling African National Congress will finalize a comprehensive policy on universal credit within two years should it return to power after next week’s election.
title: South Africa’s ANC to Finalize Policy on Income Grant by 2026

description: Rene Benko, the Austrian erstwhile billionaire now fighting bankruptcy, appeared before a parliamentary inquiry probing payments to his insolvent Signa group. He was fined for refusing to answer a lawmaker’s questions.
title: Signa’s Benko Fined by Lawmakers in Rare Public Appearance

description: A simmering legal battle between the University of California system and its unionized graduate student workers is poised to heat up as thousands of students walk off the job and both sides dig in their heels on claims the other is breaking the law.
title: California Student Strike’s Legality Hinges on Protest-Work Link

description: The French government backed a US a proposal to tap frozen Russian assets for Ukraine’s benefit, raising the prospect of a deal this week at a meeting of Group of Seven finance ministers.
title: France Aims for G-7 Deal on Russian Assets After US Proposal

description: The European Union is proposing simulating shocks to help it better understand risks for the lenders emanating from their links to other financial firms known as shadow banks.
title: EU Proposes Stress-Testing Links Between Lenders, Shadow Banks

description: The Houthi militants in Yemen have weapons that can reach as far as the Mediterranean Sea, according to a senior defense official, lending some credence to the group’s threats that it can expand its attacks on shipping beyond its immediate borders.
title: Houthis Are Using Weapons That Can Reach the Mediterranean Sea, US Says

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Down But Not Out: Who Gets Credit For Inflation Falling?

description: Mexico’s economy was finally, for the first time in years, the talk of Latin America.
title: AMLO’s Successor Will Inherit a Slowing Economy as Mexico’s Spark Fades

description: Almost a third of likely South African voters canvassed in a new opinion poll said they hadn’t decided who to support in next week’s elections or refused to disclose a preference, creating uncertainty over the expected outcome.
title: One Third of South African Voters Still Undecided, Poll Finds

description: Rishi Sunak repeated his line that a UK election will be held “in the second half of this year,” amid another round of speculation in Westminster that the prime minister will call an earlier-than-expected vote in the summer.
title: Sunak Repeats 2024 ‘Second Half’ Line as Vote Rumors Swirl

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Modi Faces Resurgent Opposition in Nehru’s City: India Votes

description: Germany will lobby for much tougher climate regulations in the European Union to quickly cut emissions in fossil-fuel heavy industries, a potentially contentious move as voters in the bloc prepare to head to the polls.
title: Germany to Push for Stricter EU-Wide Climate Rules for Industry

description: Conservative MP Craig Mackinlay has received a standing ovation as he made his first appearance in the House of Commons since his sepsis ordeal.
title: Standing Ovation for MP Craig Mackinlay on Return to Commons After Sepsis Ordeal

description: UK Defense Secretary Grant Shapps accused China of working to provide Russia with combat equipment in Ukraine.
title: UK Says China and Russia ‘Collaborating’ on Ukraine Combat Gear

description: The UK’s financial regulator approved the first cryptocurrency exchange-traded products, a step toward catching up to other financial centers in digital assets.
title: Crypto Exchange-Traded Products Get UK Regulatory Green Light

description: Buy now, pay later lenders such as Block Inc.’s Afterpay, Affirm Holdings Inc. and Klarna Bank AB should be treated in some ways like credit-card providers, according to one US financial regulator.
title: Buy Now, Pay Later Needs Credit Card-Like Oversight, CFPB Says

description: Spain is looking to refrain from naming a new central-bank governor until after next month’s European Parliament elections — potentially leaving the job vacant for weeks or even months.
title: Spain Weighs Running Out Clock on Naming New Central Bank Head

description: China sanctioned 12 American military companies and ten defense executives in retaliation against US arms sales to Taiwan and measures against Chinese firms accused of supplying Russia in the Ukraine war.
title: China Hits 12 US Military Companies With Symbolic Sanctions

description: By recognizing Palestinian statehood, Norway may have closed the door on its historic role as a mediator in the Middle East.
title: Norway Risks Mediator Status With Palestinian State Recognition

description: Russia launched an overnight drone strike on the northeastern Ukrainian Sumy region, where authorities in Kyiv have braced for a potential new front in the war.
title: Russian Strikes Cut Power in Ukraine’s Northeast Border Region

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Peril for President Xi as China’s Economic Miracle Fades

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Jordan Fabian outlines the results of the latest Bloomberg News/Morning Consult poll. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Fears of Violence, Disruption Ahead of Presidential Election

description: President Joe Biden trails Republican Donald Trump by 4 percentage points across seven battleground states in a monthly tracking poll.
title: Half of Swing-State Voters Fear Violence Around US Election

description: Swing-state voters worry AI will diminish privacy but are more upbeat about its potential impact on health and education.
title: TikTok Ban Is Popular With Voters as AI Stirs Privacy Fears, Poll Shows

description: Project will create a Microsoft cloud region in East Africa and provide competition for Chinese companies like Huawei.
title: Microsoft, G42 Announce $1 Billion Geothermal Data Center in Kenya

description: More than one in 10 Americans with federal student loans have been approved for some measure of debt relief under President Joe Biden, the White House said, as it announced a new round of forgiveness.
title: Biden Widens Student Loan Relief to More Than 10% of Borrowers

description: Kenyan President William Ruto will meet prominent executives at the White House on Wednesday as a part of his official US visit, signaling the countries’ desire to further regional business ties, particularly in the technology industry.
title: Google, Teneo Executives to Meet Kenya’s Ruto at White House

description: The UK’s two main political parties took competing positions on the significance of inflation falling to 2.3%, with both seeking to control the economic narrative ahead of a general election expected later this year.
title: Tories, Labour Spar Over UK Inflation Data as Election Looms

description: The Alternative for Germany’s lead candidate in next month’s European Parliament elections quit the far-right party’s leadership committee following a string of scandals and said he won’t take part in any more campaign events.
title: German Far-Right Party Lawmaker Steps Aside After Latest Scandal

description: Billionaire families in the US and Southeast Asia say higher taxes are the biggest risk over the next five years, topping other concerns including major conflicts and climate change, according to a new report.
title: Billionaires in US, Southeast Asia Say Higher Taxes Are Top Risk

description: Russia’s Defense Ministry set out plans to change the country’s Baltic Sea border and expand its territorial waters next to NATO rivals, prompting sharp responses from Lithuania and Finland.
title: Russia Sets Out Plan to Shift Baltic Sea Border With NATO Rivals

description: The pound rose to its strongest in two months and traders priced in fewer and slower interest rate cuts after data showed inflation slowed less than expected in April.
title: Pound Rallies, Traders Pare Bets on Rate Cuts After UK Inflation

description: The Swedish government will provide Ukraine with military support worth 25 billion kronor ($2.3 billion) annually under a new three-year framework announced Wednesday.
title: Sweden Plans $7 Billion in Military Aid to Ukraine for 2024-2026

description: A top opposition leader in India’s electorally important state of Uttar Pradesh predicts a big win for his party, saying young and poor voters are turning against Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s ruling party.
title: Indian Opposition Leader in Key State Eyes Electoral Success

description: Ireland and Spain are expected to announced plans to formally recognize a Palestinian state Wednesday, according to media reports.
title: Ireland and Spain Set to Announce Plans to Recognize Palestine

description: Nigeria’s federal cabinet last week approved construction work on the second section of a $13 billion highway awarded to an ally of President Bola Tinubu, a project that’s ignited a political firestorm in Africa’s most populous country.
title: Nigeria Taps Tinubu’s Ally to Build a $13 Billion Highway

description: BANGKOK (AP) — Zhang Zhan was released from prison after serving four years for charges related to reporting on the COVID-19 outbreak in Wuhan, according to a video statement she released Tuesday, eight days after her sentence ended, though there are concerns about how much freedom of movement she has.
title: Chinese Citizen Journalist Jailed for ‘Provoking Trouble’ While Reporting on Covid Has Been Released

description: Opposition lawmakers in Taiwan will make a final push on Friday to pass a bill aimed at reining in new President Lai Ching-te’s administration, increasing the likelihood of more large protests.
title: Taiwan Lawmakers Defy Protesters, Look to Pass Bill on Friday

description: North Korea’s cult of personality appears to have entered a new phase by elevating the portrait of Kim Jong Un next to that of his grandfather and father, showing him in a similar status as its two former leaders regarded as demigods at home.
title: North Korea Elevates Kim Jong Un’s Portrait to Make Big Three Personality Cult

description: The country’s supreme leader is trying to lay the political, military and diplomatic groundwork for his succession, and the IRGC stands to benefit.
title: Iran's Center of Power Shifts From ‘Clerical Slippers to Combat Boots’

description: China divisions are the latest sign of a bloc at odds with itself in a changing world.
title: Whether Xi or Trump, the EU Looks Vulnerable

description: A senior Philippine military official at the center of an alleged audio recording with a Chinese diplomat denied entering into an agreement with Beijing on handling the two countries’ territorial dispute in the South China Sea.
title: Philippine Navy Officer Denies Making Deal With China on Sea Row

description: Vietnam’s National Assembly elected the minister of public security as the nation’s new president, the legislature said Wednesday.
title: Vietnam Elects Police Minister as New President

description: President Javier Milei reaffirmed his campaign promise to dollarize Argentina in the clearest articulation yet of his government’s economic blueprint.
title: Argentina’s Milei Lays Out Blueprint Toward Dollarization
